column2: Kathy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this medicine after surgery to repair an inguinal hernia. I took one every 4 to 6 hours after the surgery for 2 days and found it didn't work that well to relieve my pain. It made me feel drowsy and funny in my head and also caused constipation problems. I was allowed to take 1 or 2 every 4 to 6 hours and that may have helped relieve the pain more but decided not to because of the above reasons. I usually tolerate pain well and prefer to take as little medication as possible. I eased off this medication on the third and fourth day and only took 2 a day. By the 5th day I only took one. After that I switched to taking one Extra Strength Tylenol(500 mg.)once or twice a day and feel less pain and feel much better! I don't think the Tramadol/Acet. helps for this type of surgery.

Did alittle research online under OCD dictionary and Tremadol was mentioned as effective for OCD. I found this all by accident which explained the dramatic changes I experienced. Excellent. column9: It upset my stomach and didn't ease the back pain from an inflamed nerve.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have M.S. I first used this for head pain caused by Avonex, it made it tolerable. I have since used it for near everything! I have osteo-arthritus with alot of pain, I also have severe ovary pain. This works! I love it. I only use it when I HAVE to. I can take up to 3 every 6 hours as needed, I have never needed that many! I dont use ibuprofin anymore I use this instead, it does not cause stomache problems that the ibuprofin causes, in which I have gerd,acid reflux, severe stomache spasms, ect. This does NOT bother my tummy troubles. I havent had any side effects with it except if I am ALREADY tired it will knock me out and helps me sleep better (Love that side effect!) No addiction problems with it yet, I might take 10-15 pills in a months time. I am pain tolerant, I wait till its unbearable before I will take it, and it still works great! I have took it on the onset of pain as well, seems to work the same. I would recommend it to anyone for pain. Although ANY med with REGULAR usage with become less effective over time, would require increased doses.

column2: Cheryl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have fibromyalgia, but I can't take NSAIDS because of ulcerative colitis.  I have taken tramadol with acetaminophen daily for several years, and my pain and fatigue are about 85% better when using this drug.  Recently, Aetna RX changed generic providers for it, and the new generic barely works.  I am on a quest to find a pharmacy which stocks the same generic I've been taking.  It is unbelieveable that the manufacturer of the generic can make so much difference!

column2: Rosebud, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for a couple of months now, it seems to be working. It doesn't take away all of the pain, but enough so that I can function.  It doesn't make me drowsy, but I do think that it make me hot and I sweat really really bad especially if I go outside for any amount of time, then I get chills. I take 1 tablet twice a day, 37.5mg/325. I will keep it at this level, because I feel I will have less side effects. My pain level usually runs about a nine on most days, with this it stays around a 5. I also take a muscle relaxer at bedtime. So overall I would say that its works for me. I am 60 years old and I have arthritis, carpal tunnel, fibromyalgia, and degenerative disk disease. I am active for my age and I think that helps a lot also.
